department.ch: 人力資源管理研究所碩士班

goal.en: The objective of this course is to familiarize students with leadership and communication styles, theories, and issues. The class uses a case teaching approach with a combination of lectures, presentations, and group discussions.
goal.ch: The objective of this course is to familiarize students with leadership and communication styles, theories, and issues. The class uses a case teaching approach with a combination of lectures, presentations, and group discussions.

content.en:
1 (2/22) Class introduction
2 (2/29) Introduction: Leadership and Communication
Case 1: Jean-Claude Biver: The Reemergence of the Swiss Watch Industry
3 (3/7) Oral Report 1: Trait Theory; Behavioral Theories
Case 2: Susan Duffy: Leading Quietly
4 (3/14) Oral Report 2: Contingency Theories
Case 3: Anne Boden at Starling Bank: Disrupting an Industry
5 (3/21) Oral Report 3: Attribution Theory
Case 4: Succession at Taiwan’s Hop Lion Feather Works: Not Leaving it to Change
6 (3/28) Oral Report 4: Psychodynamic Leadership Approach
Case 5: The Perils and Pitfalls of Leading Change: A Young Manager‘s Turnaround Journey
7 (4/4) No Classes - Children’s Day and Tomb Sweeping Day
8 (4/11) Oral Report 5: Neocharismatic Leadership
Case 6: Mapxus: How Complementary Partners Created the Leadership Needed to Build a Successful Innovation Start-up
9 (4/18) Oral Report 6: Leader-Member Exchange Theory
Case 7: Thomas Cook Group: Do Insiders or Outsiders Make Better CEOs?
10 (4/25) Oral Report 7: Idiosyncrasy Credit Model of Leadership
Case 8: Chem-ARC: Playing the Blame Game
11 (5/2) Oral Report 8: Symbolic Leadership
Case 9: Wells Fargo: Setting the Stagecoach Thundering Again
12 (5/9) Oral Report 9: Micro-politics Approach to Leadership
Case 10: Singareni Collieries: From Gloom to Glory
13 (5/16) Oral Report 10: Role Theory of Leadership
Case 11: Google LLC: The Diversity Manifesto and Leader Candour
14 (5/23) Oral Report 11: Social Learning Theory of Leadership
Case 12: Surbana Jurong: Navigating Organisational Challenges in a Mass Termination
15 (5/30) Project Writing
16 (6/6) Project Deadline
